content: Given an array contains  N  numbers of 0 ..  N , find which number doesn't exist in the array.
title: Find the Missing Number

content: Given a string s consists of upper/lower-case alphabets and empty space characters ' ', return the length of last word in the string.
title: Length of Last Word

content: Given an unsorted array, find the maximum difference between the successive elements in its sorted form.
title: Maximum Gap

content: Given an integer array, find a subarray where the sum of numbers is between two given interval. Your code should return the number of possible answer.
title: Subarray Sum II

content: The count-and-say sequence is the sequence of integers beginning as follows:
title: Count and Say

content: Given a string containing just the characters '(', ')', '{', '}', '[' and ']', determine if the input string is valid.
title: Valid Parentheses

content: Given an integer array, find a continuous subarray where the sum of numbers is the biggest. Your code should return the index of the first number and the index of the last number. (If their are duplicate answer, return anyone)
title: Continuous Subarray Sum

content: Given an absolute path for a file (Unix-style), simplify it.
title: Simplify Path

content: Given an integer array, find a continuous rotate subarray where the sum of numbers is the biggest. Your code should return the index of the first number and the index of the last number. (If their are duplicate answer, return anyone.  The answer can be rorate array or non- rorate array)
title: Continuous Subarray Sum II

content: Evaluate the value of an arithmetic expression in Reverse Polish Notation.
title: Evaluate Reverse Polish Notation

content: Given an integer matrix, find a submatrix where the sum of numbers is zero. Your code should return the coordinate of the left-up and right-down number.
title: Submatrix Sum

content: Given a set of  n  nuts of different sizes and  n  bolts of different sizes. There is a one-one mapping between nuts and bolts. Comparison of a nut to another nut or a bolt to another bolt is not allowed. It means nut can only be compared with bolt and bolt can only be compared with nut to see which one is bigger/smaller.
title: Nuts & Bolts Problem

content: Given a string s1, we may represent it as a binary tree by partitioning it to two non-empty substrings recursively.
title: Scramble String

content: Find the number connected component in the undirected graph. Each node in the graph contains a label and a list of its neighbors. (a connected component (or just component) of an undirected graph is a subgraph in which any two vertices are connected to each other by paths, and which is connected to no additional vertices in the supergraph.)
title: Find the Connected Component in the Undirected Graph

content: Find the number Weak Connected Component in the directed graph. Each node in the graph contains a label and a list of its neighbors. (a connected set of a directed graph is a subgraph in which any two vertices are connected by direct edge path.)
title: Find the Weak Connected Component  in the Directed Graph

content: Find the  k th smallest number in at row and column sorted matrix.
title: Kth Smallest Number in Sorted Matrix

content: Write a function that add two numbers A and B. You should not use + or any arithmetic operators.
title: A + B Problem

content: Count the number of k's between 0 and n. k can be 0 - 9.
title: Digit Counts

content: Write an algorithm which computes the number of trailing zeros in n factorial.
title: Trailing Zeros

content: Ugly number is a number that only have factors 3, 5 and 7.
title: Ugly Number

content: Find K-th largest element in an array.
title: Kth Largest Element

content: Merge two given sorted integer array  A  and  B  into a new sorted integer array.
title: Merge Sorted Array II

content: Design an algorithm and write code to serialize and deserialize a binary tree. Writing the tree to a file is called 'serialization' and reading back from the file to reconstruct the exact same binary tree is 'deserialization'.
title: Binary Tree Serialization

content: Implement a stack with min() function, which will return the smallest number in the stack.
title: Min Stack

content: Given two values k1 and k2 (where k1 < k2) and a root pointer to a Binary Search Tree. Find all the keys of tree in range k1 to k2. i.e. print all x such that k1<=x<=k2 and x is a key of given BST. Return all the keys in ascending order.
title: Search Range in Binary Search Tree

content: Given a string and an offset, rotate string by offset. (rotate from left to right)
title: Rotate String

title: Fizz Buzz

content: Given a set of distinct integers, return all possible subsets.

content: Given a list of numbers that may has duplicate numbers, return all possible subsets

content: Given three strings:  s1 ,  s2 ,  s3 , determine whether  s3  is formed by the interleaving of  s1  and  s2 .

title: Product of Array Exclude Itself

title: Next Permutation

content: Given an array of integers, find two numbers such that they add up to a specific target number.
title: 2 Sum

content: Given an array S of n integers, are there elements a, b, c, and d in S such that a + b + c + d = target? Find all unique quadruplets in the array which gives the sum of target.
title: 4 Sum

content: Given an array S of  n  integers, find three integers in S such that the sum is closest to a given number, target. Return the sum of the three integers.
title: 3 Sum Closest

content: Given a sorted array and a target value, return the index if the target is found. If not, return the index where it would be if it were inserted in order.

title: Search for a Range

content:
Follow up for "Search in Rotated Sorted Array":
What if duplicates are allowed?

content: Given two sorted integer arrays A and B, merge B into A as one sorted array.
title: Merge Sorted Array

content: Given a binary tree, return the preorder traversal of its nodes' values.
title: Binary Tree Preorder Traversal

content: Given a binary tree, return the level order traversal of its nodes' values. (ie, from left to right, level by level).

content: Given a binary tree, return the inorder traversal of its nodes' values.

content: Given a binary tree, return the postorder traversal of its nodes' values.

content: Given a binary tree, return the bottom-up level order traversal of its nodes' values. (ie, from left to right, level by level from leaf to root).

title: Construct Binary Tree from Inorder and Postorder Traversal

content: Given a binary tree, return the zigzag level order traversal of its nodes' values. (ie, from left to right, then right to left for the next level and alternate between).
title: Binary Tree Zigzag Level Order Traversal

content: Given preorder and inorder traversal of a tree, construct the binary tree.
title: Construct Binary Tree from Preorder and Inorder Traversal

content: The code base version is an integer start from 1 to n. One day, someone committed a bad version in the code case, so it caused this version and the following versions are all failed in the unit tests. Find the first bad version.

content: Given a unsorted array with integers, find the median of it.

content: Given 3*n + 1 numbers, every numbers occurs triple times except one, find it.
title: Single Number II

content: Given a root of Binary Search Tree with unique value for each node.  Remove the node with given value. If there is no such a node with given value in the binary search tree, do nothing. You should keep the tree still a binary search tree after removal.

content: Given 2*n + 2 numbers, every numbers occurs twice except two, find them.

content: Given  n  items with size A<sub>i</sub>, an integer  m  denotes the size of a backpack. How full you can fill this backpack?

content: Sort a linked list in O(n log n) time using constant space complexity.

content: In data structure Hash, hash function is used to convert a string(or any other type) into an integer smaller than hash size and bigger or equal to zero. The objective of designing a hash function is to "hash" the key as unreasonable as possible. A good hash function can avoid collision as less as possible. A widely used hash function algorithm is using a magic number 33, consider any string as a 33 based big integer like follow:
title: Hash Function

content: Design and implement a data structure for Least Recently Used (LRU) cache. It should support the following operations: get and set.

content: Given an array of strings, return all groups of strings that are anagrams.

content: Given two  32 -bit numbers,  N  and  M , and two bit positions,  i  and  j . Write a method to set all bits between  i  and  j  in  N  equal to  M  (e g ,  M  becomes a substring of  N  located at  i  and starting at  j )
title: Update Bits

content: Sort a linked list using insertion sort.

content: Given string A representative a positive integer which has  N  digits, remove any  k  digits of the number, the remaining digits are arranged according to the original order to become a new positive integer.

content: Given a (decimal -  e.g.  3.72) number that is passed in as a string, return the binary representation that is passed in as a string. If the fractional part of the number can not be represented accurately in binary with at most 32 characters, return ERROR.
title: Binary Representation

content: Given n pieces of wood with length L[i] (integer array). Cut them into small pieces to guarantee you could have equal or more than k pieces with the same length. What is the longest length you can get from the n pieces of wood? Given L & k, return the maximum length of the small pieces.
title: Wood Cut

content: Given a list of non negative integers, arrange them such that they form the largest number.

content: There are  N  gas stations along a circular route, where the amount of gas at station  i  is gas[i].

content: Find the contiguous subarray within an array (containing at least one number) which has the largest product.

content: Given a permutation which contains no repeated number, find its index in all the permutations of these numbers, which are ordered in lexicographical order. The index begins at 1.

content: Singleton is a most widely used design pattern. If a class has and only has one instance at every moment, we call this design as singleton. For example, for class Mouse (not a animal mouse), we should design it in singleton.

content: Given an integer array (index from 0 to n-1, where n is the size of this array), and an query list. Each query has two integers [start, end]. For each query, calculate the minimum number between index start and end in the given array, return the result list.

title: Interval Sum II

content: Given an integer array (index from 0 to n-1, where n is the size of this array), and an query list. Each query has two integers [start, end]. For each query, calculate the sum number between index start and end in the given array, return the result list.
title: Interval Sum

content: Given an unsorted integer array, find the first missing positive integer.

content: Given an array of n integer with duplicate number, and a moving window(size k), move the window at each iteration from the start of the array, find the maximum number inside the window at each moving.

content: Given an array of n integer, and a moving window(size k), move the window at each iteration from the start of the array, find the median of the element inside the window at each moving. (If there are even numbers in the array, return the N/2-th number after sorting the element in the window. )
title: Sliding Window Median

content: Given  n  non-negative integers representing an elevation map where the width of each bar is 1, compute how much water it is able to trap after raining.

content: Give you an integer array (index from 0 to n-1, where n is the size of this array, value from 0 to 10000) and an query list. For each query, give you an integer, return the number of element in the array that are smaller that the given integer.

title: Valid Sudoku

content: Given  n  and  k , return the  k -th permutation sequence.

content: Given two array of integers(the first array is array A, the second array is array B), now we are going to find a element in array A which is A[i], and another element in array B which is B[j], so that the difference between A[i] and B[j] (|A[i] - B[j]|) is as small as possible, return their smallest difference.

content: Given an expression string array, return the Polish notation of this expression. (remove the parentheses)
title: Convert Expression to Polish Notation

content: Give you an integer array (index from 0 to n-1, where n is the size of this array, value from 0 to 10000) . For each element Ai in the array, count the number of element before this element Ai is smaller than it and return count number array.
title: Count of Smaller Number before itself

content: Given  N  buildings in a x-axis，each building is a rectangle and can be represented by a triple (start, end, height)，where start is the start position on x-axis, end is the end position on x-axis and height is the height of the building. Buildings may overlap if you see them from far away，find the outline of them。
title: Building Outline

content: Given an interval list which are flying and landing time of the flight. How many airplanes are on the sky at most?
title: Number of Airplanes in the Sky

content: Given a string  s , find the length of the longest substring T that contains at most k distinct characters.
title: Longest Substring with At Most K Distinct Characters

content: Given a string, find the length of the longest substring without repeating characters.
title: Longest Substring Without Repeating Characters

content: Given n non-negative integers a<sub>1</sub>, a<sub>2</sub>, ..., a<sub>n</sub>, where each represents a point at coordinate (i, ai).  n  vertical lines are drawn such that the two endpoints of line  i  is at (i, ai) and (i, 0). Find two lines, which together with  x -axis forms a container, such that the container contains the most water.
title: Container With Most Water

content: There is an integer matrix which has the following features:
title: Find Peak Element II

content: Print numbers from 1 to the largest number with N digits by recursion.
title: Print Numbers by Recursion

content: Given a non-negative number represented as an array of digits, plus one to the number.
title: Plus One

content: Implement an assignment operator overloading method.
title: Assignment Operator Overloading (C++ Only)

content: Given a sorted (increasing order) array, Convert it to create a binary tree with minimal height.
title: Convert Sorted Array to Binary Search Tree With  Minimal Height

content: Divide two integers without using multiplication, division and mod operator.
title: Divide Two Integers

content: Given an array of integers, how many three numbers can be found in the array, so that we can build an triangle whose three edges length is the three numbers that we find?
title: Triangle Count

content: The gray code is a binary numeral system where two successive values differ in only one bit.
title: Gray Code

content: Given two binary strings, return their sum (also a binary string).
title: Add Binary

content: Reverse digits of an integer. Returns 0 when the reversed integer overflows (signed 32-bit integer).
title: Reverse Integer

content: There are  N  children standing in a line. Each child is assigned a rating value.
title: Candy

content: You are a professional robber planning to rob houses along a street. Each house has a certain amount of money stashed, the only constraint stopping you from robbing each of them is that adjacent houses have security system connected and it will automatically contact the police if two adjacent houses were broken into on the same night.
title: House Robber

content: Say you have an array for which the  i th element is the price of a given stock on day  i .
title: Best Time to Buy and Sell Stock IV

content: There are n coins in a line. Two players take turns to take one or two coins from right side until there are no more coins left. The player who take the last coin wins.
title: Coins in a Line

content: There are  n  coins in a line. Two players take turns to take a coin from one of the ends of the line until there are no more coins left. The player with the larger amount of money wins.
title: Coins in a Line III

content: There are n coins with different value in a line. Two players take turns to take one or two coins from left side until there are no more coins left. The player who take the coins with the most value wins.
title: Coins in a Line II

content: You have two every large binary trees: T1, with millions of nodes, and T2, with hundreds of nodes. Create an algorithm to decide if T2 is a subtree of T1.
title: Subtree

content: Implement an algorithm to delete a node in the middle of a singly linked list, given only access to that node.
title: Delete Node in the Middle of Singly Linked List

content: Given a collection of intervals, merge all overlapping intervals.
title: Merge Intervals

content: Count how many 1 in binary representation of a 32-bit integer.
title: Count 1 in Binary

content: Find the  N th number in Fibonacci sequence.
title: Fibonacci

content: Implement next permutation, which rearranges numbers into the lexicographically next greater permutation of numbers.
title: Next Permutation II

content: Given a string S, find the longest palindromic substring in S. You may assume that the maximum length of S is 1000, and there exists one unique longest palindromic substring.
title: Longest Palindromic Substring

content: Partition an integers array into odd number first and even number second.
title: Partition Array by Odd and Even

content: Give you an integer array (index from 0 to n-1, where n is the size of this array)，find the longest increasing continuous subsequence in this array. (The definition of the longest increasing continuous subsequence here can be from right to left or from left to right)
title: Longest Increasing Continuous subsequence

content: Give you an integer matrix (with row size n, column size m)，find the longest increasing continuous subsequence in this matrix. (The definition of the longest increasing continuous subsequence here can start at any row or column and go up/down/right/left any direction).
title: Longest Increasing Continuous subsequence II

content: Given an array of n positive integers and a positive integer s, find the minimal length of a subarray of which the sum ≥ s. If there isn't one, return -1 instead.
title: Minimum Size Subarray Sum

content: Given a string, determine if it is a palindrome, considering only alphanumeric characters and ignoring cases.
title: Valid Palindrome

content: Validate if a given string is numeric.
title: Valid Number

content: Given an integer, convert it to a roman numeral.
title: Integer to Roman

content: Given a boolean 2D matrix, find the number of islands.
title: Number of Islands

content: Given a 2D binary matrix filled with 0's and 1's, find the largest square containing all 1's and return its area.
title: Maximal Square

content: Given a n,m which means the row and column of the 2D matrix and an array of pair A( size k). Originally, the 2D matrix is all 0 which means there is only sea in the matrix. The list pair has k operator and each operator has two integer A[i].x, A[i].y means that you can change the grid matrix[A[i].x][A[i].y] from sea to island. Return how many island are there in the matrix after each operator.
title: Number of Islands II

content: Given a roman numeral, convert it to an integer.
title: Roman to Integer

content: Given an array A of integer with size of n( means n books and number of pages of each book) and k people to copy the book. You must distribute the continuous id books to one people to copy. (You can give book A[1],A[2] to one people, but you cannot give book A[1], A[3] to one people, because book A[1] and A[3] is not continuous.) Each person have can copy one page per minute. Return the number of smallest minutes need to copy all the books.
title: Copy Books

content: On one line there are n houses. Give you an array of integer means the the position of each house. Now you need to pick k position to build k post office, so that the sum distance of each house to the nearest post office is the smallest. Return the least possible sum of all distances between each village and its nearest post office.
title: Post Office Problem

content: Given  n  points on a 2D plane, find the maximum number of points that lie on the same straight line.
title: Max Points on a Line

content: Given a dictionary, find all of the longest words in the dictionary.
title: Longest Words

content: The structure of Segment Tree is a binary tree which each node has two attributes start and end denote an segment / interval.
title: Segmemt Tree Build II

content: Write a method to replace all spaces in a string with %20. The string is given in a characters array, you can assume it has enough space for replacement and you are given the true length of the string.
title: Space Replacement

content: Invert a binary tree.
title: Invert Binary Tree
